Upgrade.Name: Add a pintle-mounted MMG to the turret

SpecialRules: Hull-mounted LMGs (if option is taken): these two weapons must be fired against the same target
Vulnerable: +1 additional penetration to side & rear hits (total +2 side, +3 rear)

SpecialRules: Improved HE: Instead of HE (1") the medium anti-tank gun has HE (2").

Weapons.Name: Turret-mounted medium anti-tank gun with co-axial MMG

Upgrade.Name: Add a pintle-mounted MMG on the turret
Upgrade the pintle-mounted MMG to a pintle-mounted HMG

Improved HE: Instead of HE (1”) the medium anti-tank gun has HE (2”)
Bulldozer Blades: Down order to clear adjacent obstacle (turns to rough ground) or fill AT ditch; may assault buildings; treat as super-heavy tank (front armour 11) when assaulting buildings

Weapons.Name: Turret-mounted heavy anti-tank gun with co-axial MMG

Upgrade.Name: Add a pintle-mounted MMG on the turret
Upgrade the pintle-mounted MMG to a pintle-mounted HMG

SpecialRules: By Air, Land, and Sea (if taken)
HQ Choice: A force can include a single chaplain, who is not part of any of the platoon selectors, in the same manner as a company commander.
By Air, Land, and Sea (if taken)
Self-defence: see the Medic entry in the Bolt Action rulebook, page 113.

Inspiring Presence: Upon receiving his order die (except for Down), a chaplain may select 1 friendly unit within 6” and roll a D6, applying the following modifiers: Inexperienced -1, Veteran +1. On a 4+, the chaplain may remove 1 pin from the selected unit
By Air, Land, and Sea (if taken)
Selection: For each of these squads included in the platoon, you are allowed to include one additional Bazooka team in the same platoon (only in platoons that allow Bazooka teams to begin with).

Mechanised Infantry: This unit can re-roll any failed order test that is required to mount or dismount a transport vehicle. In addition, if their transport vehicle is destroyed, this unit suffers D3 hits rather than D6 hits.

Selection: A maximum of 1 Armoured Infantry Mortar Squad may be taken for each platoon. If this squad is included in the platoon, you are allowed to include one additional Bazooka team in the same platoon (only in platoons that allow Bazooka teams to begin with).

Mechanised Infantry: This unit can re-roll any failed order test that is required to mount or dismount a transport vehicle. In addition, if their transport vehicle is destroyed, this unit suffers D3 hits rather than D6 hits.
Light mortar (1 per squad in addition to rifle, with loader)

Weapons.Name: Turret-mounted medium anti-tank gun with co-axial MMG

Upgrade.Name: Add a pintle-mounted MMG on the turret
Upgrade the pintle-mounted MMG to a pintle-mounted HMG

SpecialRules: Easily Catches Fire: if fire result, add D3 pins instead of 1 before morale test
Improved HE: Instead of HE (1”) the medium anti-tank gun has HE (2”)
Flamethrower requires an assistant (another man becomes the assistant)
LMG requires a loader (another man becomes the loader)
LMG requires a loader (another man becomes the loader)

LZ Signals: If at least one unit of Pathfinders is not in reserve (i.e. is deployed or in first wave), then any friendly paratroopers, pathfinders and glider units in reserve may re-roll failed order tests to come onto the table from reserve.
Includes one light machine gun and loader (counts within squad models)
Recon Troops: The unit will spot hidden enemy units at 18” rather than the normal 12°.
Regimental Units: A force can include a maximum of 2 I&R Squads.
Early War: only 1 BAR may be taken
Long-range Penetration: When outflanking, as described in the Bolt Action rulebook (see page 172), Merrill’s Marauders may re-roll failed order tests for coming onto the table.
Cavalry (if the horses option is taken)
By Air, Land, and Sea (if taken)
By Air, Land, and Sea (if taken)
By Air, Land, and Sea (if taken)
Selection: You may take Heavy Weapons Rifle Teams instead of either Mortar or Machine Gun Teams in any Heavy Weapons Platoon.
By Air, Land, and Sea (if taken)
